name: Dinuguan Recipe
description: Pork sauteed in onion and garlic and cooked with pork blood. This Filipino version of blood stew is something to try by adventurous eaters.
author: Vanjo Merano
f1: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan. Sauté garlic and onion.
f2: Step 2: Once the onion softens, add pork. Continue to sauté for 5 minutes or until light brown.
f4: Step 4: Add  pork cube. Cook in low heat until the meat tenderizes.
f5: Step 5: Add pork blood. Stir. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes while stirring.
f6: Step 6: Pour vinegar and add sugar and long green pepper. Cook for 12 to 15 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Season with salt and pepper as needed. Serve hot with puto.

name: Igado Recipe
description: Stewed pork, liver, and kidney with green peas and bell pepper. This popular Filipino recipe is a must try.
author: Vanjo Merano
step1: - 2 lbs. pork tenderloin sliced into 2 inch strips
step8: - 1 piece red bell pepper cut into strips
f1: Step 1: Heat the cooking pot and pour-in the cooking oil.
f2: Step 2: When the oil is hot enough, sauté the garlic and onions.
f3: Step 3: Add the pork tenderloin and continue cooking until the color of the outer part turns light brown.
f4: Step 4: Pour-in the soy sauce and water then simmer until the pork is tender.
f5: Step 5: Add the pig’s kidney, dried bay leaves, salt, and pepper and cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
f6: Step 6: Add the pig’s liver and vinegar then simmer for another 10 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Put-in the carrots and simmer for 3 minutes.
f8: Step 8: Add the green pea and red bell pepper and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Allow the liquid to evaporate to thicken the remaining sauce.
f9: Step 9: Transfer to a serving plate then serve. Share and Enjoy!

name: Lechon Kawali Recipe
description: This is a recipe for lechon kawali or crispy deep fried pork belly.
author: Vanjo Merano
f1: Step 1: Pour water on cooking pot. Boil
f2: Step 2: Add the pork belly and 1 tablespoon of salt. Put some pepper and bay leaves. Boil for 30 minutes or until meat gets tender.
f3: Step 3: Remove the meat from the pot and let it cool down for a few minutes.
f4: Step 4: Spread 1 tablespoon of salt on the pork belly. Make sure to distribute it evenly on all sections.
f5: Step 5: Start to deep fry the boiled meat. Heat oil on a cooking pot.
f6: Step 6: Put each piece of boiled pork belly into the hot oil with extra caution. Fry until crispy. Turn the meat over to completely fry the opposite side until crispy. Note: be extra careful when frying as oil can splatter. You can use the cover of the pot to cover it while oil splatters, but do not cover completely as steam will be trapped. It will cause more splatters.
f7: Step 7: Remove the meat from the cooking pot. Arrange on a wire rack to cool down.  Slice according to desired portions.
f8: Step 8: Serve with lechon sauce. Share and Enjoy!

name: Pata Tim Recipe
description: Tender pork leg stew with mushroom and bok choy.
author: Vanjo Merano
f1: Step 1: Set turbo broiler to 350F. Broil pata for 20 minutes.
f2: Step 2: Boil water in a cooking pot. Add broiled pata. Boil for 15 minutes. Drain water and then wash the pata with running water.
f3: Step 3: In a clean cooking pot, arrange the pata. Pour soy sauce, Sesame oil, cooking wine, and water. Add whole peppercorn. Boil for 1 to 2 hours or until pork gets tender. Note: you can use a pressure cooker to tenderize the pork leg quicker.
f4: Step 4: Add Knorr Pork Cube, star anise, and Shitake mushrooom. Cook for 20 minutes. Note: add more water if needed. Make sure that there is at least 2 ½ cups of sauce in the pot.
f5: Step 5: Add sugar. Stir. Pour cornstarch and water mixture. Stir and cook until sauce thickens.
f6: Step 6: Add baby bok choy. Cook for 2 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Transfer to a serving plate. Serve. Share and enjoy!

name: Paksiw na Pata Recipe
description: Tender pork leg stew with mushroom and bok choy.
author: Vanjo Merano
step1: - 2 lbs Pork hock pata, sliced crosswise
step7: - 100 grams banana blossoms dried, soaked in water
f1: Step 1: Boil 6 cups water in a pot. Add the pork hock. Continue to boil for 15 minutes. Discard water and wash the pork with running water until all impurities are cleaned.
f2: Step 2: Pour the water in a pot and bring to a boil. Add the whole pepper corn and dried bay leaves
f3: Step 3: Pour soy sauce into the pot and add the garlic.
f4: Step 4: Put-in the sliced pork hock and simmer for 1 to 1.5 hours (or cook in pressure cooker for 30 minutes)
f5: Step 5: Add the vinegar and simmer for 10 minutes
f6: Step 6: Place the banana blossoms in and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Add the brown sugar and salt and simmer for 2 minutes
f8: Step 8: Serve hot. Share and Enjoy!

name: Pata Hamonado
description: Sweet Filipino Pork Hock with Soy Sauce and Pineapple.
author: Vanjo Merano
step1: - 3 ½ lbs  pork hock  pata, sliced or whole
f1: Step 1: Boil 4 cups of water in a cooking pot. Add pork hock. Let boil for 15 minutes. Discard water. Set the pork aside.
f2: Step 2: Heat cooking oil in a cooking pot. Saute garlic and onion.
f3: Step 3: Add the boiled pork hock once the onion softens.
f4: Step 4: Pour soy sauce, pineapple juice, and water. Let boil. Add whole peppercorn and dried bay leaves Pressure cook for 18 minutes. Note: if not using a pressure cooker, boil pork for 90 minutes on a regular cooking pot. Make sure to add water if the liquid is about to dry-up.
f5: Step 5: Add Knorr Pork Cube, brown sugar, and pineapple chunks. Stir. Let it simmer until the sauce reduces to half.
f6: Step 6: Season with salt. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!

name: Pork Adobo Recipe
description: Basic Filipino Prok Adobo with Soy Sauce, Vinegar, and Garlic. This delicious dish is perfect when served over newly cooked white rice.
author: Vanjo Merano
f1: Step 1: Combine the pork belly, soy sauce, and garlic then marinade for at least 1 hour.
f2: Step 2: Heat the pot and put-in the marinated pork belly then cook for a few minutes.
f3: Step 3: Pour remaining marinade including garlic.
f4: Step 4: Add water, whole pepper corn, and dried bay leaves then bring to a boil. Simmer for 40 minutes to 1 hour.
f5: Step 5: Put-in the vinegar and simmer for 12 to 15 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Serve hot. Share and enjoy!

name: Pork Bicol Express Recipe
description: Pork cooked in coconut milk mixture with chillies and shrimp paste. This is a dish has the spiciness and delicious taste that is perfect with white rice.
author: Vanjo Merano
step1: - 1 lb. pork shoulder sliced into cubes
step2: - 3 pieces long green pepper siling pansigang, sliced into thin pieces
step3: - 8 pieces bird’s eye chili siling labuyo or Thai chili, sliced into small pieces
f1: Step 1: Heat oil in a cooking pot.
f2: Step 2: Sauté garlic and onion until the onions get soft.
f3: Step 3: Add the ground black pepper and pork. Sauté until the color turns light brown.
f4: Step 4: Pour 1 1/2 cups water. Let boil. Cover and continue to cook in medium heat until the pork gets tender and the water almost evaporates completely.
f5: Step 5: Prepare the gata by combining ¾ cup lukewarm water and Knorr Ginataang Gulay mix. Stir until the powder dissolves completely. Set aside.
f6: Step 6: Add the long green pepper, chili pepper, and shrimp paste into the cooking pot. Stir.
f7: Step 7: Pour the gata mixture into the pot. Let boil. Cover and cook in medium heat until the liquid reduces to half. Make sure to stir once in a while.
f8: Step 8: Add salt to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl.
f9: Step 9: Serve with rice. Share and enjoy!

name: Pork Binagoongan Recipe
description: Pork Belly cooked in tomato and shrimp paste with eggplant. This dish is a winner!
author: Vanjo Merano
step1: - 1 1/2 lb. pork belly cut into cubes
f1: Step 1: Heat oil in a cooking pot.
f2: Step 2: Saute onion, garlic, and tomato. Once the onion becomes soft, add the pork belly. Cook until the belly turns light brown.
f3: Step 3: Add shrimp paste (bagoong alamang). Stir. Cook for 5 minutes.
f4: Step 4: Pour vinegar. Let the mixture boil. Stir and cook for 2 minutes.
f5: Step 5: Pour the pork stock into the pot. Cover and let boil. Adjust the heat to medium and continue to cook for 40 minutes or until the pork gets tender. Note: add water or pork stock as needed.
f6: Step 6: Add eggplant. Stir. Cover the pot and cook for 3 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Season with sugar and ground black pepper.
f8: Step 8: Transfer to a serving plate. Serve. Share and enjoy!

name: Pork Menudo
description: This is a recipe for basic pork menudo. It is a delicious dish that makes use pork, liver, and vegetables such as carrot and potato.
author: Vanjo Merano
f1: Step 1: Combine pork, soysauce, and lemon in a bowl. Marinate for at least 1 hour.
f2: Step 2: Heat oil in a pan.
f4: Step 4: Add the marinated pork. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes..
f5: Step 5: Pour in tomato sauce and water and then add the bay leaves.Let boil and simmer for 30 minutes to an hour depending on the toughness of the pork. Note: Add water as necessary.
f6: Step 6: Add-in the liver and hotdogs. Cook for 5 minutes.
f7: Step 7: Put-in potatoes, carrots, sugar,salt, and pepper. Stir and cook for 8 to 12 minutes.
